'''David Poore''' is a [[British people|British]] independent musician, who has composed and produced music for over 200 films by the [[BBC]], [[ITV]], [[Channel 4]], [[Disney]], [[Public Broadcasting Service|PBS]], [[National Geographic]], [[RTÃ]] and other broadcasters.<ref name="BDI-biography">{{cite web|url=http://www.bdimusic.com/Composer.aspx?ComposerID=1010|title=BDI Music, Publisher's biography|accessdate=2011-01-13}}</ref>
==Education== David studied at [[Wells Cathedral School]] in Somerset from 1974 to 1984. While there he was a choral scholar in [[Wells Cathedral]] Choir and also studied drums and piano, playing percussion in the school orchestra for the duration of his time at Wells. He then went on to study jazz, played drums in various bands, and also became a drum teacher. He then attended [[Newport Film School]] in Wales in 1987.<ref name="Poore-biog">{{cite web|url=http://www.davidpoore.com/|title=David Poore - biography|accessdate=2009-06-10}}</ref>
==Career== Following several years working as a sound designer and dubbing mixer for Bristol based TV post production company [http://www.filmsat59.com/ Films At 59], David began his composing career in 1990 with work for the [[BBC Natural History Unit]], and was soon providing music for two of the network's main natural history series, ''[[Wildlife on One]]'' and ''[[BBC Natural World]]'', whilst also providing music for news and current affairs documentaries for the BBC's Nature department.
He went on to provide the score for both [[David Attenborough]]'s ''[[Life In Cold Blood]]'', winner of the BAFTA Award for Best Factual Series in 2009,<ref name="bafta.org">{{cite web|url=http://www.bafta.org/awards/television/tv-noms-2009,709,BA.html|title=BAFTA Winner â Best Factual Series 2009 â Life In Cold Blood}}</ref> and ''[[Life In The Undergrowth]]'' with fellow Bristol composer Ben Salisbury, with whom he also co-wrote ''[[The Nature of Britain]]'' series presented by [[Alan Titchmarsh]]. He wrote music for ''[[Planet Earth (TV series)|Planet Earth]]'s'' accompanying conservation films ''[[Planet Earth - The Future]]''. David's TV scores also include the long-running BBC series ''[[Big Cat Diary]]'' and a sequence of BBC nature documentaries, ''[[Orangutan Diary]]'', ''Elephant Diary'', and ''Chimpanzee Diary'' with [[Charlotte Uhlenbroek]].
===Notable compositions=== David's work on the BBC's ''[[Springwatch]]'' series earned a [[Royal Television Society]] (RTS) nomination in 2007 for the title theme (see Awards and Nominations).
His music is also featured in Channel 4's ''[[Grand Designs]]'' since 2007, and ''[[Dispatches (TV series)|Dispatches]]''.
David has also written several series for children including for Disney ''Mr Moon'', a [[Computer-generated imagery|CGI]] space adventure series which has aired worldwide<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.axapac.com/news/singapore/playhouse-disney-uk-and-canada-broadcasters-pick-mr-moon|title=UK and Canada broadcasters pick Mr Moon|accessdate=2011-03-01}}</ref> on the [[Playhouse Disney]] Channel since May 2010,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/10148068|title=Over the moon at Disney success|accessdate=2011-03-04 | work=BBC News|date=2010-05-28}}</ref> and ''[[Henry's Amazing Animals]]'', and for the BBC ''Growing Up Wild''.
David composed incidental music used in the feature film ''Ocean Voyager'', narrated by [[Meryl Streep]], which was subsequently performed in London by the [[Royal Philharmonic Orchestra]].
===Selected TV scores=== * Score for the acclaimed ITV series ''In The Wild'' including films with [[Goldie Hawn]], [[Bob Hoskins]] and [[Christopher Reeve]] * BBC's ''[[The One Show]]'' * ITV's ''[[Celebrity Fit Club]]'' * BBC One's ''[[Omnibus (UK TV series)|Omnibus]]'' * ''Degas and the Dance'' (for [[Public Broadcasting Service|PBS]]) * [[National Geographic]] series ''Africa'', * ''[[Mountain Gorilla (TV series)|Mountain Gorilla]]'' * ''[[The Secret Life of Elephants]]'' * ''[[Tales from the Green Valley]]''
He has also written for Bristol-based [[Aardman Animations]]. David has recorded with orchestras and musicians from The [[London Philharmonic Orchestra]], The [[BBC Concert Orchestra]], and The [[Bristol Ensemble]], to a selection of extremely accomplished solo artists which have included Kit Morgan (Guitar), Stuart Gordon (Violin), Dirk Campbell (Ethnic Wind Instruments), Dan Newell (Trumpet), [[Andy Sheppard]] and [[Will Gregory]] (Saxophone), [[Adrian Utley]] (Guitar), [[Paul Clarvis]] (Percussion), Belinda Sykes and Abbie Lathe (Vocals), recording at [[Abbey Road Studios]] and Air Edel Studios in London, and Christchurch Studios in Bristol.
===Additional Work===
David played drums for the live concert of the music for the BBC series 'Nature's Great Events' performed by the BBC Concert Orchestra at Bristol's Colston Hall in September 2009, and narrated live by Sir David Attenborough. The music was composed by Ben Salisbury and Barnaby Taylor and conducted by [[William Goodchild]].
David can also be heard on the critically acclaimed 2008 [[Portishead (band)|Portishead]] album ''[[Third (Portishead album)|Third]]'', singing additional vocals on the track "Deep Water" with Ben Salisbury (collectively credited as "The Somerfield Workers Choir"), and Team Brick .
==Awards and nominations== In 2005 David's work on the film ''Ireland'' for the BBC's ''[[Natural World (TV series)|Natural World]]'' and [[Public Broadcasting Service|PBS]] Nature [http://www.pbs.org/wnet/nature/episodes/ireland/introduction/2337/] earned him an [[Emmy]] Nomination for Outstanding Individual Achievement In A Craft.<ref name="Emmy-nomination">{{cite web|url=http://emmyonline.tv/releases/pdf/26thNewsNominationsReleaseFinal.pdf|title=The 26th Annual News and Documentary Emmy Award Nominees|format=PDF|accessdate=2011-01-10}}</ref>
He received a nomination for the [[Royal Television Society]] (RTS) Awards in 2007 for the BBC ''[[Springwatch]]'' for Outstanding Original Main Title Theme Music.<ref name="RTS-nomination">{{cite web|url=http://www.rts.org.uk/Info_page_two_pic_2_det.asp?art_id=6957&sec_id=3510|title=RTS Craft and Design Awards 2007|accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref>
Further recognition followed at the 2008 [[Wildscreen Festival]], where the episode 'Armoured Giants' from the BBC series ''[[Life In Cold Blood]]'', including David's compositions for the soundtrack, was awarded the prestigious Golden Panda Award.<ref name="Wildscreen-Golden=Panda">{{cite web|url=http://www.wildscreen.org.uk/downloads/Festival2008_summary.pdf|title=Wildscreen Festival, 2008 Panda Award Winners|format=PDF|accessdate=2011-01-24}}</ref>
The TV series ''Life In Cold Blood'' and ''Life In The Undergrowth'', featuring David's compositions, both received BAFTA recognition in 2005<ref name="BAFTA-Nomination">{{cite web|url=http://www.bafta.org/awards/television/nominations/?year=2005|title=BAFTA Nomination - Huw Weldon Award for Specialist Factual Series 2005 â Life in The Undergrowth|accessdate=2011-02-12}}</ref> and 2009.<ref name="bafta.org"/>
